did.abstract: Collection includes a newspaper clipping of a republished letter, 1780, from Hamilton to Elizabeth Schuyler concerning the Benedict Arnold affair and the death of Major John André, and an original letter, 1791, to Abisha Thomas and James Taylor, treasury agents for North Carolina, enquiring whether North Carolina had ever issued its own certificates of indebtedness in lieu of those of the United States.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Alexander Hamilton was a Revolutionary War officer and U.S. Secretary of the Treasury under George Washington.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes a newspaper clipping of a republished letter, 1780, from Hamilton to Elizabeth Schuyler concerning the Benedict Arnold affair and the death of Major John André, and an original letter, 1791, to Abisha Thomas and James Taylor, treasury agents for North Carolina, enquiring whether North Carolina had ever issued its own certificates of indebtedness in lieu of those of the United States.
